courses.description: JSS3 Mathematics course covering number systems, algebra, geometry, and statistics.

lessons.description: Conversion between number bases and binary operations.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers number bases, including conversion between base ten and other bases. It also introduces binary operations and their applications.

lessons.description: Factorization of algebraic expressions and solving equations with fractions.
lessons.textContent: This lesson focuses on the factorization of algebraic expressions and solving equations that involve fractions. It also covers simultaneous linear equations.

lessons.description: Understanding Pythagoras' rule and basic trigonometric ratios.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces Pythagoras' rule for right-angled triangles and the basic trigonometric ratios: sine, cosine, and tangent.

lessons.description: Introduction to data presentation and measures of central tendency.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers methods of data presentation and introduces measures of central tendency, such as mean, median, and mode.

lessons.description: Calculating compound interest and solving problems on proportion.
lessons.textContent: This lesson deals with commercial arithmetic, including the calculation of compound interest and solving problems involving direct and inverse proportions.

courses.description: JSS3 English course focusing on grammar, speech, composition, and literature.

lessons.description: Understanding phrases and clauses and their use in sentences.
lessons.textContent: This lesson explains the difference between phrases and clauses and how they are used to construct complex sentences. It also covers direct and indirect speech.

lessons.description: Study of stress and intonation patterns in English.
lessons.textContent: This lesson focuses on the use of stress and intonation in spoken English to convey meaning and emotion.

lessons.description: Learning to write argumentative essays.
lessons.textContent: This lesson teaches students how to write argumentative essays, including how to structure an argument, provide evidence, and write a conclusion.

lessons.description: Introduction to fiction and non-fiction and their characteristics.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the concepts of fiction and non-fiction in literature and discusses their key characteristics and differences.

lessons.description: Expanding vocabulary with a focus on idiomatic expressions.
lessons.textContent: This lesson focuses on expanding vocabulary by learning and using common idiomatic expressions in English.

courses.description: JSS3 Basic Science covering health, environment, and physics concepts.

lessons.description: Effects, prevention, and control of drug and substance abuse.
lessons.textContent: This lesson discusses the effects of drug and substance abuse, and the roles of agencies like NAFDAC and NDLEA in prevention and control.

lessons.description: Introduction to genetics and the importance of family traits.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the concept of genetics and explains the importance of family traits and heredity.

lessons.description: Understanding soil erosion, deforestation, and other environmental hazards.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers various environmental hazards such as soil erosion, deforestation, flooding, and the depletion of the ozone layer.

lessons.lessonTitle: Resources from Living and Non-living Things
lessons.description: Exploring resources from plants, animals, and solid minerals.
lessons.textContent: This lesson explores the various resources that can be obtained from living things (plants and animals) and non-living things (solid minerals).

lessons.description: A basic introduction to the concept of radioactivity.
lessons.textContent: This lesson provides a basic introduction to the concept of radioactivity, including its properties and uses.

courses.description: JSS3 Social Studies covering family, social issues, and peace and conflict.

lessons.lessonTitle: The Family as a Basic Unit of Society
lessons.description: Understanding the role of the family in society.
lessons.textContent: This lesson explains why the family is considered the basic unit of society and discusses the roles of extended family members in child development.

lessons.description: Factors, consequences, and prevention of human trafficking.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers the issue of human trafficking, including the factors that contribute to it, its consequences, and ways to prevent it.

lessons.description: Definition and consequences of harmful traditional practices.
lessons.textContent: This lesson defines harmful traditional practices and discusses their negative consequences on individuals and society.

lessons.description: The importance of peace and methods of conflict resolution.
lessons.textContent: This lesson discusses the importance of peace and explores various methods of conflict management and resolution.

lessons.description: The importance of goal setting and how to make good decisions.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers the importance of setting personal goals and provides guidance on how to make effective decisions.
